tekst: OPEN O U T F E S T I VA L FESTIVAL INTRODUCTION - festival statement Open Out Festival is an an annual one-week art festival putting forward queer artists and performers and serving as a strong and important player to make the art scene in Tromsø more diverse, accessible and open! Our primary goal is to showcase high quality contemporary art within a queer perspective - we want to put forward hidden and marginalised voices and challenge the white, heteronormative perspective, that is still dominating the art world and the cultural events accessible in Tromsø. The aim of the festival is three-fold: * to strengthen the presence of queer, feminist and intersectional per- spectives in the art scene and more generally in society * to make quality art events accessible to a broader, younger and more diverse audience * to stimulate artistic creation and queer community building in Northern Norway through a local and global approach THI S D O CUM M E N T IISS A V I S U A L P R E E SS EEN NT A ATT II O N OF OF OPEN O U T FES S TT I V A L 2 0 2 2 - F R U I T S P ER RFFO ORRM MA NC AN CE ES , _. --:"),- .. , Jr Let Let it pour, it p o u r , Let Let it it Rain by (Co)opulence Collective Glory pocket Glory pocket by Status by S t a t u s Queer (SE/IS) Fruits of of the t h e Sea by Malin Nordström Nordström (SE) YOU YOU WILL WILL NEVER NEVER KNOW KNOW HOW HOW IT IT FEELS FEELS by Zain Saleh and Michael(a) Daoud (PS/SY/DE) Citrus Paradisi by Pawel Swierczek and Mateusz Trzebiatowski (PL) Let’s decide together where this takes us Let's us by Filip Kijowski (PL/UK) • .
